Description: Neck and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic-black figured pottery closed vessel, probably an olpe; interior reserved with drip of black near top; exterior: part of black glazed neck with dilute line below; band, two vertical lines framing scene at right; in reserved panel, black-figure lion to right, head looking beck (head and neck, part of back remaining; added red on muzzle, eye, tongue, mane and added white on teeth).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B103.20.2)
Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 42, no. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 299, no. B290)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 144, note 11)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0288) (Phase 1)
